page.text: You have disabled the robot, it slumps into a heap of tangled robotic limbs and actuators.

choice.text: try to remove its computational components
try to remove its weapon system

page.text: You attempt to extract the computational parts of the robot intact. But your lack of skill leads to you breaking them in your inept attempt to rip them out. They're useless now, but at least you have a few wires and chunks of the robot's casing as souvenirs. Or maybe as paperweights or raw material for future use.

choice.text: ah well, better luck next time

page.text: You attempt to extract the delicate computation valves. The devices take a careful touch to extra from the surrounding systems but you manage it. You've managed to successfully extract two computation valves from the robots 'brain' and to celebrate you dismantle some of its wiring and casing to get some additional raw materials.

You think you can extract the robot's weapon system, cause everything is better with lasers. Alas you're not as clever as you think you are and the robot's combined sensor and laser focusing optics are reduced to uselessness by your fumbling.

You look at the robot's head consideringly, it's probably too much to attempt to extract the laser system whole cloth but some elements may be valuable. You set about dismounting the optical lenses and mirrors from inside the robot's otherwise empty head. Soon enough you have some relatively intact optical components for future use.

choice.text: ah well, least these might come in handy
